Amid an outbreak of coronavirus in 2020, an email from pathologist James Robb
was heavily memed and exaggerated.

The letter is attributed to pathologist James Robb who described
   himself as “one of the first molecular virologists in the world to work on
   coronaviruses.” The letter itself provides common-sense solutions to
   preventing disease transmission:

     1) NO HANDSHAKING!

In the late 1970s,
   as professor of pathology at the University of California, San Diego, Robb
   published some of the earliest descriptions of coronaviruses.
